intro: Spermacoce pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered spurred grassvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers. The flowers are typically white or pink and have five petals, with a distinctive spur at the base of each petal. The plant produces small, spherical fruits called schizocarps, which split into two one-seeded parts upon maturity. It is native to various regions in Africa and is often found in dry, open habitats.
